DWP Citizen Core Attributes

ARA documentation on Citizen Core Attributes


 


This component has a dependency on DWP Matching. Thus we also need DWP Matching, see below.

MYC will handle Citizen core attributes, like the citizen's name. These data may be managed by the Citizen Core Attributes application.

 Thus, we need for a specific Citizen (using GUID first provided by Matching application) to be able to get and update:
•Forename and Surname → Not managed by DWP External Identity?
•Date of Birth
•Date of Death
•NINO? → Not managed by DWP Matching or External Identity?

DWP Citizen Event history

ARA documentation on Citizen Event History


 


This component has a dependency on DWP Matching. Thus we also need DWP Matching, see below.

We need to provide a timeline of the interactions and notes taken previously in the context of an NS-JSA claim.

Note: we do not know whether work coaches would be interested in seeing interactions from other benefits, e.g. UC.

Thus, we need for a specific Citizen (using GUID first provided by Matching application):
•Send new events to the Event history
•See the list of interaction for NS-JSA only for the moment;
•For each interaction, we need to store and get:•Unique ID;
•Date;
•Time;
•Format, e.g. face-to-face home, face-to-face jobcentre, phone, video call, letter, email, SMS;
•Type: Initial Work Search Interview (Commitment interview), Recurrent Work Search Interview, Change of circumstances, etc...


Note (after discussion with Paul Ryder):
•Identity Agent involved in interaction (might not be stored in Event Story → stored in event source, e.g. us)
•Notes taken during interactions are not stored in the Citizen Event History application, it needs to be stored in source, e.g. MYC.

Team: Data analytics team - 

DWP Citizen Relationships

ARA documentation on Citizen Relationships


 


This component has a dependency on DWP Matching. Thus we also need DWP Matching, see below.

We need to know whether a person has an appointee. If a person has an appointee, then interactions should be performed with the appointee. NS-JSA currently gets this information from CIS.

Thus, we need for a specific Citizen (using GUID first provided by Matching application):
•To know whether a person has an appointee
•Appointee details•Full name;
•Contact details;


Note: Verification of identity is done by the External Identity service

Status: Passed pre-discovery. See https://intranet.dwp.gov.uk/news/sharing-caring-simons-virtual-visit-ddsp?pk_campaign=indigital&pk_kwd=25-09-2020

Team:  Citizen Information team

DWP Citizen Residency

ARA documentation on Citizen Residency


 


This component has a dependency on DWP Matching. Thus we also need DWP Matching, see below.

If the claimant provides a new address during one of the NS-JSA MYC interviews, we need to update the Citizen Residency enterprise application. We also need to get the latest address if the citizen has provided DWP with a new address, outside the NS-JSA/MYC context, e.g. UC.

Thus, we need for a specific Citizen (using GUID first provided by Matching application) who could be the claimant or appointee:
•Get the latest current address;
•Get date address was updated;
•Get address type: residential, temporary address e.g. rehabilitation centre;
•Provide new current address;
•Provide address type: residential, temporary address e.g. rehabilitation centre.

Note: Phone number, correspondence address and email are held by Notification service. The MYC service does not need to hold that information.

Status: Infancy. See https://intranet.dwp.gov.uk/news/sharing-caring-simons-virtual-visit-ddsp?pk_campaign=indigital&pk_kwd=25-09-2020

Team:  Citizen Information team

DWP Safeguarding

ARA documentation on Safeguarding

Among the markers presented to the agents, indicators as PV are paramount. Such markers will drive the correct procedure to handle a claimant and their claim, e.g. the usage of a dedicated meeting room with the close presence of a security guard. 

Thus, we need:
•Get the list of the markers so they can be displayed to the agents and they can apply the right procedures.

DWP Matching

ARA documentation on Matching

Since we ask for the NINO in the application form, we do not really need the Matching service. However, we need to use this service to get the internal GUID used by DWP to identify claimants uniquely. The GUID is necessary to use DWP Citizen Relationships and DWP Citizen Event History enterprise applications.

Since we identify a citizen by their NINO (for the moment), we need:
•Lookup a citizen via a NINO;
•Get their GUID.

Note: We should not use NINO in the future. We should use the Matching service to match a claimant with an internal citizen and get their DWP's GUID. When NS-JSA apply changes and do not request the NINO, then we should use the Matching service to identify the citizen using their: full name, date of birth, current/previous addresses.

Status: Live. Used by Carers Pathfinder. See https://intranet.dwp.gov.uk/news/sharing-caring-simons-virtual-visit-ddsp?pk_campaign=indigital&pk_kwd=25-09-2020

Team:  Citizen Information team - Jacqui Mcguigan

DWP Tasks

ARA documentation on Tasks.

Not workflow. When ask somebody wants a manual step to be done,  and can create affinity workcoach to citizen. so fraud can ask something to be verified. There is a Task UI but can build and use APIs.

At the moment we do not envisage a citizen self-service option for MYC. Self-service has been mentioned and will probably be on a roadmap, but it will probably not be in the MVP. However, agents may requests claimants to perform some tasks that will be checked at the next interview. Agents themselves will probably have tasks to complete related to a claim. Thus, it is likely that we shall need to integrate to the DWP Tasks enterprise application.

Therefore, we may need:
•Provide, retrieve, mark as completed tasks for a citizen or an agent:•GUID of the citizen or ID of agent;
•Claim it is related to;
•Date due or period; 
•To be done by the citizen or appointee or agent;
•Status: unaasigned, assigned, worked on, completed, close;
•Can cable and update a task.
•Be able to send reminder by email or SMS or MYC to receive notifications near the due date. > Citizen receive SMS a task but then need portal


DWP Notifications

ARA documentation on Notifications

NS-JSA already sends an email (GDS Notify) to the claimant to confirm the submission of the claim and reminding them of the documents they will need to provide to support the claim. MYC will also need to send notifications, for instance to remind the claimant/appointee of an interview. 

Thus, we need:
•Send an email (and maybe SMS) to citizen & appointee confirming next interview appointment;
•Send a SMS  (and maybe an email) to remind the citizen & appointee of a coming interview;
•Send a SMS or email to citizen or appointee about a task they need to complete;
•Send email and/or letter when reached end of NS-JSA claim with information about claiming Class 1 stamp;
•The service needs to easily change the templates of the standard messages (emails, SMS or letter);•The template should offer the possibility to have conditional fields so we can have tailored messages sent, e.g. with the relevant list of pieces of evidence that a claimant needs to bring to support their claim;

•Work coaches would like to be able to send "non-standard"  ad-hoc messages. → Clerical notification (there is a manual step behind the scenes)

DWP Evidence

ARA documentation on Evidence

For some NS-JSA specific NS-JSA claims, the citizen is asked to bring evidences, e.g. Pension papers. The system should help the work coach handle the evidences brought. Also DWP Agents (work coach, decision makers...) should be able to check whether evidences have been provided and review them to check their validity.

Thus, we need, for a specific claimant (GUID):
•See list and content of evidences already provided (work coach, processing agents, decision maker, fraud and error agent, disputes/appeals agents)
•Add new evidence (mainly work coach and processing agents)
•Remove old or invalid evidence?

DWP Reference Data

ARA Documentation on Reference Data

G4S and work coaches need to know what is the nearest Jobcentre to a citizen address to book an interview. They also need to make sure the Jobcentre has the facilities to support the interviews when a claimant has special needs. This information is needed when a claim is submitted (update of NS-JSA) or when a claimant moves to a new address while is claiming NS-JSA. Further information on the jobcentre is also needed when booking an interview, e.g. rooms.

Thus, we need:
•"Closest" Jobcentre to a postcode;
•List of facilities of the jobcentre: accessibility, audio loops, etc;
•Public phone number to contact jobcentre;
•List of rooms available to book and appointment for some specific interviews, e.g. when claimant has a PV marker against them. ERP SOP has that info at the moment.

Multiple projects? e.g. Working Age would have JobCentre... DNA defines who would own.

DWP Internal Identity

ARA documentation on Internal Identity

Necessary to identity Agents. Note: NS-JSA uses ADFS. ADFS may become an identity provider for Internal Identity.

For time being ADFS.

We need:
•A transparent way to get the identity of the Agents (SSO);
•Receive information on the Agent compatible with the requirements of Audit (ATAS2 or replacement of ATAS2);
•Receive the name of the Agent to display on screen if necessary;
•Have a notion of role attached to the user to control access to the functions of MYC. Note: NS-JSA receives the roles from ADFS.

Will the roles be handled by Internal Identity? 

DWP People

ARA documentation on People

We probably need to know whether an agent is going to be on Leave and know their skills in order to manage the appointments. Need to check user needs for MYC.

Notes:
This product enables agents and contracted partners acting on behalf of the DWP to schedule and participate in video meetings with citizens and any third parties supporting a citizen (collectively referred to as citizens in the remainder of this document), in support of their on-going engagements with the Department. An agent is able to specify the time and duration of a meeting, and send a link to a citizen which allows them to join that meeting using a supported browser.

Citizens are able to access a meeting from a compatible PC, tablet or mobile with audio and video capabilities using a web browser only. There is no requirement to download any additional software or an app in order to join a meeting. During the meeting, an agent is able to control it, and see how many people are participating at any time.

Specifically, it allows an agent to:
•Specify the time, duration and attendees of a video meeting
•Email a link to citizens to allow them to join a meeting
•Join a meeting with citizens
•See how many people are in a meeting
•Agents only are able to control the access of citizens during (e.g. mute a participant)

It allows citizens to:
•Join meetings using a supported browser (Chrome, Safari or Edge)
•Read guidance in preparation for a meeting

The service supports the concept of a waiting room for attendees prior to a meeting starting, with the organiser being informed of arrivals. It is secured end-to-end, and meetings are time-bound so participants can't be left in a connected state after the meeting's scheduled time slot.

It is based on open source WebRTC standards, so is portable between WebRTC compliant SDKs. As a citizen-facing service, it is fully compliant with Government design and accessibility standards
